posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Maybe it's time for this article in the NWNWiki to be updated, for I have found zero evidence in EE that Rakshasa Shape can conduct Empowered or Maximized Ice Storms through quickslots.  Further, I have found no evidence to support any advantage gained by Druid levels for determining damage dice.  In my clinical trials, a Rakshasa with 8 Druid levels and a Rakshasa with 28 Druid levels consistently did the same amount of damage for Ice Storm: 30-40 points.

Was this something documented by EE in one of their updates?  I don't recall if it was.  And can anyone confirm they get the same results as me for using the metamagic quickslots.  If all of this is true, it's kind of a big change and will throw a bucket of ice water on a lot of old (and new) Druid Shifter builds.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Rakshasa (along with other polymorph forms) was nerfed in EE, metamagic can't be used with shifted abilities anymore.
In 1.69 you could quickslot a maximized Ice Storm and cast it while polymorphed, in EE your character won't be able to cast it.
You can still quickslot spells without metamagic and use them while polymorphed.

However, the spell level rules are the same for both 1.69 and EE.
If you quickslot Ice Storm from a spellbook (eg Druid spellbook) then the caster level of the Ice Storm while polymorphed will be equal to the level of that class.
If you quickslot Ice Storm from the shifter ability section or cast Ice Storm with a right click while shifted then the caster level of the Ice Storm will be equal to the level of your first class.
So a Druid28/Shifter10/Monk2 would have a level 28 Ice Storm when shifted, while a Monk2/Druid28/Shifter10 would have a level 2 Ice Storm.
If you quickslot Ice Storm from the Druid spellbook and use that then both of the above builds would have a level 28 Ice Storm.
